free_text.Learning outcomes: The student will learn how to numerically solve mathematical problems of practical interest in engineering applications, and choose appropriate algorithms in each case.
free_text.Content: -	Stability, condition number and convergence of numerical methods.[br/]-	Polynomial interpolation and least squares approximation.[br/]-	Numerical integration.[br/]-	Direct methods for the solution of linear systems.[br/]- Iterative methods for the solution of linear and nonlinear systems.[br/]-	Numerical approximation of ordinary differential equations.[br/]-	Finite difference approximation of 2-point boundary value problems.[br/]-	Introduction to MATLAB/OCTAVE.
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra lectures, exercises in the classroom and on the computer
free_text.Form of examination: The exam might require using a computer and MATLAB/OCTAVE software.
